page.title: 07Employment - Factory.
page.content: With the closure of the Great Mountain Colliery in the 50's a small factory was built and opened during those years in Bethesda Road, Tumble. Its chief purpose was to provide work for unemployed miners. The factory is now the main source of work in Tumble. The present occupiers in July, 1985 are Brockhouse Modernfold Ltd., who make folding doors and operable movable walls and partitions from P.V.C. materials, metal and wood. 45 people are employed, 25 of whom live in Tumble and the remaining 20 travel to work by private cars from the surrounding area. The products are sold by sales representatives and distributors, they are also exported to Saudi Arabia, Africa, France and Pakistan.
